about.p1: The BiData project is funded by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and runs from 1.11.2023 to 31.10.2025. The project aims to create a shared platform for automated data collection from beehives on √Öland, in collaboration between √Öland University of Applied Sciences and stakeholders in √Öland‚Äôs agricultural sector.
about.title2: Why is the BiData project important for √Öland?
about.p2: √Öland is Finland‚Äôs apple orchard and accounts for over 70% of all domestically sold apples. But for apples to grow, the flowers must be pollinated in spring ‚Äî and this is where bees play a crucial role. Many apple growers have their own hives, or they collaborate with local beekeepers. Traditional beekeeping is a craft based on experience, and there are many risks such as diseases or starvation during late winter. The goal of this project is to reduce predictable risks through automated data collection.
about.title3: The weight of the beehive tells us how the colony is doing
about.p3: The hive‚Äôs weight and temperature are important indicators of colony health. A scale is placed under the hive and connected to a small computer with a transmitter. The entire setup runs on batteries and solar power. This is an example of IoT ‚Äî the Internet of Things ‚Äî where data from different sources is connected to reveal patterns and larger contexts. In this way, we can collect real-time data about the colonies‚Äô condition without physically inspecting the hives and disturbing the bees. With this information, it becomes easier to decide when to take action ‚Äî for example, in early spring when food is scarce in nature.
about.title4: Accessible data through the Internet of Things (IoT)
about.p4: Data from the various measuring stations is collected into a database that is publicly available online through this website. Beekeepers can follow the development of different hives without physically visiting them. This provides a better basis for making the right decisions at the right time. Visitors can also explore data from the different measuring stations, see what kind of information is collected, and follow the development of the hives over time. Sort by date or measuring station, for example, to get a clearer picture of how the colonies are doing throughout the year or during a specific period.
about.title5: A collaborative project between the EU, √Öland University of Applied Sciences, and local farmers
about.p5: Thanks to the project, both beekeepers and apple growers have established new connections and collaborations. The BiData project is funded by the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EAFRD) and runs from 1.11.2023 to 31.10.2025. The project‚Äôs goal is to create a shared platform for automated data collection from beehives on √Öland, in collaboration between √Öland University of Applied Sciences and actors in √Öland‚Äôs agricultural sector.

manual.dataSync.title: Data & Sync
manual.dataSync.p1: Data is saved on a schedule via cron jobs that pull from the API into the database for daily and hourly aggregates.
manual.dataSync.li1: Charts and lists read from these stored aggregates.
manual.dataSync.li2: If a time window looks empty, the device may have been offline or the job delayed ‚Äî try a refresh and check device status.
manual.overview.title: Overview
manual.overview.p1: This manual explains each page in the Beehives app and where to find controls for time ranges, metrics, downloads, and navigation.
manual.overview.li3: Use the search box to jump to any section
manual.scales.title: Scales (List)
manual.scales.p1: The Scales page lists every scale. Use the buttons on each card to quickly view aggregated data or jump to charts.
manual.scales.li1: Daily / Hourly buttons: open views showing daily or hourly data (aggregations).
manual.scales.li2: Go to Charts: opens the specific scale‚Äôs chart view, focused on that scale.
manual.scales.li3: Downloads (Admin only): if you‚Äôre logged in as an admin, you‚Äôll see a button to download .csv for all data.
manual.scaleDetail.title: Scale ‚Äì Chart View
manual.scaleDetail.p1: Visualize data for a single scale with full control over metric and time range. Ideal for deep dives.
manual.scaleDetail.li1: Metric picker: choose the metric (e.g., weight, temperature, etc.).
manual.scaleDetail.li2: Scale picker: switch to another scale without leaving the page.
manual.scaleDetail.li3: Date range controls: pick exact dates or use quick ranges (24h / 7d / 30d / weekly / monthly).
manual.scaleDetail.li4: Rapid navigation: jump backward/forward by the current window size (e.g., ¬±1 week or ¬±1 month).
manual.scaleDetail.li5: Download (signed-in users): export a .csv of the current chart view (respects selected scale, metric, and time window).
manual.weightCharts.title: Weight-Charts (Multi)
manual.weightCharts.p1: Compare multiple scales in one place with flexible layouts and quick time filters.
manual.weightCharts.li1: Control panel: choose scales, time range, and preset time buttons (7d / 30d / 90d, etc.).
manual.weightCharts.li2: Layout: toggle between one multi-chart (overlaid series) or small multiples (one chart per scale).
manual.weightCharts.li3: Legend: click legend items to show/hide individual series.
manual.maps.title: Maps
manual.maps.p1: See each weighbridge/gauging station on the map. Click on a marker to preview the latest key data and navigate quickly.
manual.maps.li1: Marker popup: shows last-day data for that scale.
manual.maps.li2: Links: ‚ÄúGo to Scale‚Äù (opens the scale page) and ‚ÄúOpen Current Chart‚Äù (opens the chart view focused on that scale & time).
manual.admin.title: Admin
manual.admin.p1: Available only to admin users. Manage scales and data directly from the database utilities.
manual.admin.li1: Data controls: tools for reviewing, importing, fixing, or deleting records (where exposed by the UI).
manual.about.title: About data & synchronization
manual.about.p1: Data is saved on a scheduled basis as daily and hourly aggregations. If a time range appears empty, the device may have been offline or the job may have been delayed. Try refreshing and checking the status of the meter.
